description: From French béchique or its source Latin bēchicus (“of or for a cough”), from Ancient Greek βηχικός (bēkhikós, “of or for a cough”), from βηχ- (bēkh-), oblique stem of βήξ (bḗx, “cough”).

adjectives.description: bechic (comparative more bechic, superlative most bechic)

entries.meaning: (dated) Relating to, or relieving, a cough.
examples: The bechic blast, which is the principal vehicle for removing pathological material, is dependent for its action on the pressure of air below it.
Medicines which alleviate cough are called bechics
